com.vk.sdk

Class VKSdk

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vk.sdk.VKSdk

  • public class VKSdk
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point of SDK. See example for using properly

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context applicationContext)
        Call this method to prepare VK SDK for work. Best for call - in your application class. Don't forget to call this method when you starting a service
        Parameters:
        applicationContext - context of current application

      • login

        public static void login(android.app.Activity activity,
         java.lang.String... scope)
        Starts authorization process. If VK app is available in system, it will opens and requests access from user. Otherwise UIWebView with standard UINavigationBar will be opened for access request.
        Parameters:
        activity - current running activity
        scope - array of permissions for your applications. All permissions you can

      • login

        public static void login(android.app.Fragment fragment,
         java.lang.String... scope)
        Starts authorization process. If VK app is available in system, it will opens and requests access from user. Otherwise UIWebView with standard UINavigationBar will be opened for access request.
        Parameters:
        fragment - current running fragment
        scope - array of permissions for your applications. All permissions you can

      • onActivityResult

        public static boolean onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                       int resultCode,
                       android.content.Intent data,
                       VKCallback<VKAccessToken> vkCallback)

      • getAccessToken

        public static VKAccessToken getAccessToken()
        Deprecated. Use VKAccessToken.currentToken() instead
        Returns token for API requests
        Returns:
        Received access token or null, if user not yet authorized

      • wakeUpSession

        public static boolean wakeUpSession(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if an access token exist and performs a try to use it again
        Parameters:
        context - An application context for store an access token
        Returns:
        true, if an access token exists and not expired

      • wakeUpSession

        public static boolean wakeUpSession(android.content.Context context,
                    VKCallback<VKSdk.LoginState> loginStateCallback)
        Checks if an access token exist and performs a try to use it again
        Parameters:
        context - An application context for store an access token
        loginStateCallback - if callback specified, VKCallback.onResult(Object) method will be called after login state changed
        Returns:
        true, if an access token exists and not expired

      • notifySdkAboutApiError

        public static void notifySdkAboutApiError(VKError apiError)
        Common check for access denied errors
        Parameters:
        apiError - error from VKRequest

      • logout

        public static void logout()
        Wipes out information about the access token and clears cookies for internal browse

      • isLoggedIn

        public static boolean isLoggedIn()
        Indicated if an access token exists and not expired
        Returns:
        true if a token exists and not expired

      • getApiVersion

        public static java.lang.String getApiVersion()
        Returns:
        Returns specified API version for VK requests
